badges.label: Fossil CO₂ Only
badges.description: The emissions series includes CO₂ from burning coal, oil, gas, flaring, and relevant industrial processes (e.g., cement & steel); it **excludes** any CO₂ released or absorbed through land‑use change.

badges.label: Land‑Use Excluded
badges.description: Totals omit emissions from deforestation or re/afforestation, so comparisons can under‑represent countries where land‑use change is large.

badges.label: International‑$ Unit
badges.description: GDP values are in constant 2011 international dollars—i.e., adjusted for domestic inflation **and** purchasing‑power differences so one unit buys the same basket of goods everywhere.

badges.label: Overlapping Elements
badges.description: Dense regions (e.g., South‑/East‑Asia) contain many circles that occlude one another and may hide smaller nations.

badges.label: Adjusted Baseline
badges.description: Baselines are shifted because log scales cannot show zero; readers should keep this in mind when judging relative gaps.

badges.label: Truncated Axis
badges.description: The GDP axis starts at ≈ $1 000 (not zero) and the CO₂ axis at 0.01 t, which can change perceived distances.

badges.label: Log Scale Used
badges.description: Both axes are logarithmic so that values spanning several orders of magnitude fit on one chart.

badges.label: Open Data
badges.description: Underlying dataset (Global Carbon Budget 2024, Maddison Project, population tables) is openly available for download.

badges.label: Data Source Disclosed
badges.description: Figure caption cites each primary source, allowing verification and re‑use.
